tier_1_determinative.ipc_sections_charged: 376(3) of IPC and Section 6 of the POCSO Act

tier_2_material.motive_for_crime: Not explicitly stated, possibly opportunistic due to the circumstances of being alone with the victim.

tier_3_contextual.place_of_offense: First floor room of the victim's house

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abbas Sk. @ Abbas Hossain Vs. State of West Bengal
tier_4_procedural.judges_coram: Justice Joymalya Bagchi and Justice Ananya Bandyopadhyay
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Mr. Pratip Kr. Chatterjee, Mr. Gautam Banerjee, Mr. Anjan Dutta
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Mr. Sudip Ghosh, Mr. Apurba Kr. Datta
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Section 376(3) of IPC, Section 6 of the POCSO Act, Section 376(2)(i) IPC (initially), Section 4/6 of POCSO Act

residual_details.additional_facts: The victim was lured and raped by the accused who was a private tutor. The crime was reported by the victim's aunt. The medical examination confirmed severe injuries to the victim. The forensic report did not find evidence of semen. The defense highlighted contradictions in witness testimonies and procedural lapses, arguing for acquittal. The prosecution's case was supported by medical evidence and witness testimonies.
